div.p: All buildings are closed in Burlington Township. We are conducting school via Distance E-learning. Visit our COVID-19 website for more information.

img.alt: Picture of BT Students at Hopkins Building field.

p.a: Meal Distribution During BTSD Distance E-Learning

div.p: BTSD meal distribution is considered essential under the Governor’s Executive Order #107. BTSD will continue to provide meals to those students whose families request meals.
Important Announcment-DO NOT DROP YOUR CHILD OFF AT ANY BURLINGTON TOWNSHIP SCHOOL
Please click here for the BTSD distance e-learning COVID-19 CONTINUITY PLAN 2020-03-11, revised 2020-03-23.

p.a: The Burlington Township Foundation Wants You!

div.p: The Burlington Township Board of Education approved and adopted the 2020-2021 calendar. Please note that due to changes in various state testing, some dates are subject to change.

p.a: Wee Kids-Before and After School and Pre-K Programs
2020 Military Wall of Honor…Calling all BT Alumni!

div.p: The Military Wall of Honor for Burlington Township High School Alumni, the project will specifically focus on alumni who are currently serving or have served in any of the five branches: Air Force, Army, Coast Guard, Marine Corps, and Navy.
The deadline to submit information for the 2020 Induction is April, 2020. Honorees must have graduated from Burlington Township High School and were honorably discharged or are currently serving.
We are looking for new inductees for the 2020 Military Wall of Honor. Click this link for more information and to recommend an inductee.

div.a: Burlington Township Middle School @ Springside 8th Grade Chorus - Virtual Choir - City of Stars
div.div: Director - Roxanne Ferguson Video - Juan Carlos Gonzalez-Najera We miss singing together so much!! Please enjoy our first virtual choir song. We're so bummed...

a.title: Share this post in your email

div.div:
A big thank you to BTHS teacher, Ruth Seel, for making masks for our staff. During these very peculiar times it is very nice to know that the well being of the front line folks is a concern. Taking action to keep our staff safe is amazing and we are extremely grateful to great people like Ruth!
Thank you Ruth Seel!!

section.p: The Burlington Township School District is committed to making our website accessible for students, staff, and the community. You may request information in an alternate format. Please contact the community relations office to make requests.
